� FUNCTION DESCRIPTION:
� General information:
Depending on the ECU?s con?guration the CCP (Can Communication Protocol) can
? be inactive,
? run on the CAN-line also used for the PT-messages (vehicle CAN).
? run on a CAN-line used for calibration only
The wanted con?guration is determined during startup of the ECU within the reset event evaluation. Accord-
ingly the CAN-drivers have to be con?gured:
0) no external CAN
The ECU should neither react on any incoming CCP-message on any line (e.g. no interrupts) nor be able to
send any CCP-message on an external line.
1) CCP-messages on PT-CAN
The ECU should exclusivly react on an incoming CCP-message on the PT-CAN-line and send the outgoing CCP
messages exclusively on that CAN line.
1) CCP-messages on CAL-CAN
The ECU should exclusivly react on an incoming CCP-message on the CAL-CAN-line and send the outgoing
CCP messages exclusively on that CAN line.

MCPC, MCPC General
The application system is evidence of visualization of intern data of the engine management system and for
modi?cation of the calibration data. Therefore different links are possible.
1. NONE: This operation mode is always possible (as_chosen = 0). No applicaton-system is available or
active.
2. ETK: Necessary for this operation mode is a ETK-S 4.2B from ETAS and a TC1797ED. Calibration data is
accessed from ?ash memory(reference page) or ED memory(working page). Measurement data will be
done by DISTAB13-protocol (as_chosen = as = 1). If a ECU was used with an ETK once you can?t use it
for CCP anymore. To use the ECU with CCP you have to recon?gure as_chosen manually.
3. CCP: Necessary for this operation mode is a TC1797ED. Calibration data is accessed from ?ash mem-
ory(reference page) or ED memory(working page). (as_chosen = as = 2).
4. CCP_PT: It is possible to read out some online variables via vehicle CAN. (as_chosen = as = 3).
5. GSI: TBD for SC1 500 (as_chosen = as = 4)
Detection of ECU_TYPE:
For ECUs with a TC1797ED ECU_TYPE = W_APPLRAM, otherwise ECU_TYPE = W_O_APPLRAM. The variable will
be saved before jumping to CBOOT SW at a ?x location inside the NVMY.
� Application conditions:
� Initialisation at early startup:
IF TC1797ED available
THEN ED-Device available
IF necessary ETK-Hardware available
THEN ETK available
ECU_TYPE = W_APPLRAM
ELSE
ECU_TYPE = W_O_APPLRAM
� Initialization at reset:
Make sure that as_chosen is already read from NVMY.
IF ETK-HW available
THEN as = ETK
IF as_chosen is not ETK
THEN as_chosen = ETK and save to NVMY
ELSE IF ED-Device available and as_chosen not ETK
THEN as_chosen = as = CCP
ELSE as_chosen = as = CCP_PT
ENDIF
Check which application system is selected and do all necessary initializations
IF AS = 0H ("NONE")
THEN Deactivate CCP
ELSEIF AS = 1H ("ETK")
THEN use ETK f or access to calibration data and activate ETK for measuring
ELSE IF AS = 3H ("CCP_PT")
THEN initialize vehicle CAN for CCP messages and initialize CCP for measuring
ELSE IF AS = 2H ("CCP")
THEN initialize calibration CAN for CCP messages and initialize CCP for calibration and measuring

� ETK-S CAL-Wakeup feature
If the CAL-Wakeup feature is set in Inca the ETK checks if the ECU is ruuning every time Inca is trying to access
the ECU. If the ECU is switched off the ETK will switch on the ECU and the ECU will wait for a download of
a working page into the ED-RAM. In this state the Boot SW is running and the powerstages of the ECU are
switched off. The only thing the user can do in this state is to download a working page into the controller
and switch between working page and reference page in Inca. Additionally it is possible to program a new
refernce page into the ECU?s ?ash via PROF. You can leave this special state by applying the ignition key or by
disconnecting Inca from the ETK. After Inca is disconnected the ECU will power down after a given time. If you
switch on the ignition key the ECU will reset and start running the application SW.
At late startup in application SW
IF CAL-Wakeup is set by Inca
THEN jump to Boot SW
Wait until ignition key ist set or Inca is disconnected
IF ignition key is detected and no ?ashing operation is in progress
THEN reset ECU
IF Inca is disconnected
THEN power down ECU
� ETK-S Flashing feature
It is possible to ?ash the ECU-SW via ETKs and Inca/PROF. It is possible to ?ash the calibration data or the
application SW including update of Boot SW depending on the used PROF con?guration. During a active CAL
wakeup it is possible ?ash the calibration data only.

� Autostart behavior for ETK-S
To solve some problems at the SW testbench it is possible to force the ETK to start from the reference page
only. The page setting in Inca is not taken into account in this case. If a power failure has be deteced by the
ETK the ECU also starts from the reference page.
At the evaluation of the page setting from Inca at reset
IF power failure detected by ETK-S
THEN start from reference page
ELSE IF lc_etks_rp_only
THEN start from reference page
ELSE IF coherency check between application SW and working page data is okayAND
Inca requests starting form working page
THEN start from working page
ELSE start from reference page
IF Inca requests starting from reference page
THEN start from reference page
� Measuring at beginning or end of TASK with ETK only
For all measurement rates two DISTAB13 rasters are available(except 1ms rate). Additionally the user can select
if the measurement data should be transfered to the ETK at the beginning or at the end of the corresponding
operating system task is executed. This selection can be done for each DISTAB13 raster.
START OF TASK
IF lc_distab_pre_xxxxx
THEN transfer data at beginning of task
CALCULATE ALL FUNCTIONS IN TASK(e.g. all 10ms functions)
IF NOT lc_distab_pre_xxxxx
THEN transfer data at end of task
END OF TASK
� Measuring reset values with ETK only
It is possible to trigger the 100ms DISTAB13 rasters at the end of the ECU reset event to get the initalization
values for the selected measurment datas.
At end of reset event:
IF lc_etk_disp_rst_vals
THEN transfer data in 100ms rasters to display the initialization values
� Meaning of the word "cylinder"
If this speci?cation talks about a cylinder it means the current ?ring cylinder or segment.

� FUNCTION DESCRIPTION:
� General information:
The aim of the CCP Tuning functionality is to calibrate and gather data from a prototype engine control unit
via the development or serial ECU CAN. The software must support INCA calibration tool.
The main principle is to emulate the Flash calibration and online data by an available RAM chip (external
or internal). All selected parameters (online data & calibrations) will be sent to the Calibration tool in order to
simulate the engine behaviour.
In case of external RAM availability, the calibration values can be changed to realise a full test of engine func-
tionality. Once these calibrations changed, the tuning functionality can save them into the ?ash area.
The online data are grouped in several DAQ lists according with the refreshing rate, which can be time or
cylinder event dependent. Time dependent DAQ lists are two: one for 10ms and one for 100ms. Segment
dependent DAQ lists is one for each cylinder and the sending is done at TDC event per each cylinder.
Through this main functionality, several subtle mechanisms and services allow to enlarge calibration possibili-
ties:
? A switch page allows coming back to a reference calibration page.
? A suspended mode allows to record online data at reset (key ON)(Resume Mode).
? A calibration saving at Power Latch to keep a calibration model (Store Bit).

MCPC, CAN calibration protocol tuning
In case of no external RAM availability, only the Data Acquisition mode will be supported . In this case for
security access reason CCP Tuning requires to use a Seed & Key mechanism to be activated. Moreover, it will
be possible to inhibit the complete functionality using a calibration.
Terminology - Acronyms
CAN: Controller Area Network: communications protocol developed and maintained by Robert Bosch
GmbH. The protocol is designed to manage multiplexed communications between multiple CPUs.
CCP: Can Calibration Protocol: developed by Ingenieurb�ro Helmut Kleinknecht and adopted
by the ASAP task force as a standard protocol for data acquisition and calibration.
DTO: Data Transmission Object: message sent from the slave device to the master device
(Command Return Message or Event Message or Data Acquisition Message).
CRO: Command Return Object: message sent from the master device to the slave device.
ODT: Object Descriptor Table: list of elements (variables), used for organization of data acquisition.
DAQ: Data AcQuisition: de?nition of a procedure and messages sent from the slave device to the
master device for fast data acquisition from an ECU.
WP: Working Page: de?nition of calibration page which can be changed via calibration tool.
RP: Reference Page: de?nition of initial calibration page which can not be changed.

� FUNCTION DESCRIPTION:
� General information:
In order to activate the functionality, some tests are performed. They are the following:
? Detection of the external RAM,
? Inhibition or activation of the CCP functionality,
? Seed & Key algorithm de?ned by the CCP protocol.
Initialization: at reset
LV_CCP_PT_CAN_ACT = 0
Recurrence: none
Activation: at reset
Deactivation: none
� Formula section:
If(1) external RAM not available
Then(1) no external RAM is detected, the ECU is a serial one
If (2) PT_CAN_ACT is ACTIVE
Then (2) PT CAN activated
If (3) C_CCP_PT_ACT = 0x4328 (checking of calibration)
Then (3) the pattern activate the CCP on the serial ECU
LV_CCP_PT_CAN_ACT = 1
CCP for serial ECU activated
Else(3) CCP for serial ECU is not activated (due to the wrong calibration value)
LV_CCP_PT_CAN_ACT = 0
Endif (3)
Else (2) CCP not active LV_CCP_PT_CAN_ACT = 0
Endif (2)
Else (1) CCP for serial ECU inactive
CCP for development is active
Endif(1)
If(4) LV_CCP_INH 0
Then(4) Perform the initialization
Copy calibration data from internal Flash to external RAM
Switch ON mirroring for CCP-RAM

� General information
Two kind of communication functionality exist between the ECU and Calibration tool:
? A master-slave command protocol, which is used to handle the Calibration Tool (master) to the ECU
(slave) communication on CAN (CRO & DTO).
? A continuous time-based or event-based data transfer cycles
Command received Object (CRO):
The Command Receive object is used for reception of a set of command codes.
Parameters in message ?eld:
Position Type Description 
0 Byte CCP Command = CMD 
1 Byte Command counter = CTR 
2..7 Byte Command related parameters and data area 
 
Data Transmission Object (DTO):
Two different kinds of answer are possible: positive or negative in case of error:
Parameters in message ?eld in case of error:
Position Type Description 
0 Byte Data packet ID = PID = 0xFF 
1 Byte Error code 
2 Byte Command counter = CTR 
3..7 Byte Parameter and data field 
 
Parameters in message ?eld in case positive answer:
Position Type Description 
0 Byte Data packet ID = PID = 0xFF 
1 Byte Command returned  code = 0x00 
2 Byte Command counter = CTR 
3..7 Byte Parameter and data field

Calibrations
� FUNCTION DESCRIPTION:
� General information:
Working with calibration is possible only in case of external RAM presence
Calibration is one of two basic functions of the CCP. The download and upload of the calibration data set into
and from the ECU offers the possibility to tune functions and compare calibration results.
The ECU shall support calibration by substitution of the initial calibration data set in the non-volatile memory
by an External RAM based calibration data set. The content of the start-up External RAM calibration data set
is equal to the ROM calibration data set. Accesses to the calibration data sets are possible by the upload
and download commands of the CCP. The veri?cation of the calibration data set is possible with the BUILD_
CHKSUM command.
The supported calibration data pages should be switchable by using the SELECT_CAL_PAGE command with
the appropriate base address of the pages. Thus, the software should have the same switch possibility
between Flash (RP) and External RAM (WP). The client implementation of the CCP has to insure coherent
writes of all word and long word data into the calibration memory of the ECU.

DAQ sending
� General information:
The DAQ list part is divided into 3 different refreshment events . Thus, the mapping is organised to support in
external RAM 1 Time, 1 Display and one cylinder (only in case of external RAM) related refreshment events via
the calibration tool. Time event contains a maximum of NC_ODT_TIME_SIZE ODT. The Display event contains
a maximum of NC_ODT_DISP_SIZE ODT. The cylinder events contain a maximum of NC_ODT_SYNC_SIZE ODT
. According to these different types of refreshment (Time, Disp and Sync (only in case of external RAM)), DAQ
buffers has to be build for each event. These different refreshment events are completely independent. Thus,
they are mixed into queuing buffer with a different PID (Packet Identi?er).
The ECU has to ensure coherent transmission of these data types in the DAQ packets. An overload condition
during the transmission of the online data should be signalled to the tool.

� FUNCTION DESCRIPTION:
� General information:
Depending on the ECU?s con?guration the CCP (Can Communication Protocol) can
? be inactive,
? run on a CAN-line exclusively used for CCP (Application-CAN),
? run on the CAN-line also used for the PT-messages (Vehicle-CAN).
The wanted con?guration is determined during startup of the ECU within the RST event evaluation. Accord-
ingly the CAN-drivers have to be con?gured:
0) no external CAN line (hal_can_set_ccp = 0)
The ECU should neither react on any incoming CCP-message on any line (e.g. no interrupts) nor be able to
send any CCP-message on an external line.
1) CCP-messages on PT-CAN (hal_can_set_ccp = 1)
The ECU should exclusivly react on an incoming CCP-message on the PT-CAN-line and send the outgoing CCP
messages exclusively on that CAN line.
2) CCP-messages on Applicaton-CAN-line (hal_can_set_ccp = 2)
The ECU should exclusively react on an incoming CCP-message on the dedicated CCP-CAN-line and send the
outgoing CCP messages exclusively on that CAN line.

MCPC, CAN calibration protocol tuning on CAN powertrain
There is no need (coming from CCP) for modifying the con?guration after having selected one at ECU-startup
(RST event) nor having the CAN-driver initialized before.
The different CAN-line may be operated with different parameters (e.g. timing, baud rate).
The application system is evidence of visualization of intern data of the engine management system and for
modi?cation of the calibration data. Therefore different links are possible.
1. NONE: This operation mode is currently possible (as_chosen = 0). No applicaton-system is available.
2. ETK: Necessary for this operation mode is a ETK-T 2.1c at /CS2. Calibration data will be accessed from
ETK s memory. Adaptive data will be accessable by ETK. Measurement Data will be copied by DISTAB13-
protocol to ETK s memory (as_chosen = 1).
3. CCP: Necessary for this operation mode is a TC1797ED. Calibration data will be accessed from the ED-
RAM that is swapped according to the selected page (working page, reference page). Calibration and
measurement data are transmitted by CCP on a CAN-bus separated from the Power train CAN between
the ECU and the application system (as_chosen = 2).
4. CCP_PT: No external RAM necessary. It is possible to read out some online variables via Vehicle-CAN.
CCP-Flashing works on Vehicle-CAN too (as_chosen = 3).
Detection of ECU_TYPE:
For ECU s with Application RAM ECU_TYPE = W_APPLRAM, otherwise ECU_TYPE = W_O_APPLRAM. The Vari-
able will be saved before jumping to CBOOT SW in NVRAM Fix Located to have it available in CBOOT SW.
� Application conditions:
Initialisation at early startup:
IF ETK available
THEN copy CAL reference string from ?ash to ETK RAM for ETK/INCA code check
save CAL reference string from ?ash for comparison with CAL in ETK
IF CAL data in ETK ?ts to ASW SW version
THEN do nothing
ELSE Shut down CAL driver
lv_as_etk_avail = 1
ecu_type = NC_ECU_TYPE_W_APPLRAM
deactivate ETK
ELSE Shut down CAL driver and initalize again
IF ED RAM availible
THEN ecu_type = NC_ECU_TYPE_W_APPLRAM
lv_as_ed_avail = 1
ELSE ecu_type = NC_ECU_TYPE_W_O_APPLRAM;
Shut down CAL driver
Initialization at reset:
Make sure that as_chosen is already read from EEPROM.
Make sure as_chosen ?ts to current HW. If not as = NONE
IF lv_as_etk_avail = 1
THEN as = NC_AS__ETK
ELSEIF lv_as_ed_avail = 1
THEN as = NC_AS__CCP
ELSE as = NC_AS__CCP_PT

� General Information
? Bypassing
This speci?cation describes the boundary conditions of the bypassing, which are given by the software imple-
mentation. Therefore no input and output data are speci?ed, because the choosing of these data will be done
by a con?guration via external rapid prototyping (RPT) software.
dSPACE:
(GSI is currently not supported)
Each individual dSPACE bypassing is characterized by its bypass number. Two service IDs (SvcID) representing
the start (data transfer from ECU to RPT tool; even number) and the end (data transfer from RPT tool to ECU;
odd number) of the bypassing.

MCPC, Rapid prototyping manager
The bypasses can be enabled/disabled with the calibration constant C_RPT_ENA. These calibrated values are
copied into RPT_ENA which shows the current status of the respective bypass.
ETAS:
For SBB bypassing there is only one number to characterize the bypass. The locations of the bypassing
services are described by declaration of the chronology of services and bypassed speci?cations or reference
points respectively. Reference points have to be used in case of bypassing for totally new functions.
Single bypasses can be deactivated by the ETAS tooling. To deactivate the whole SBB you can use the calibra-
tion variable. The bypasses can be enabled/disabled with the calibration constant LC_ETK_SBB_ENABLE.
Hint: The bypass numbers within the same calling recurrency (e.g. 10 ms) represent the same order than the
calling order itself.
Already implemented functions, which are bypassed, are calculated simultaneously with the RPT model. At
the end of the bypassed section the concerned ECU variables can be overwritten by the RPT tool using the
model values.
For the ETK bypasses the initialisation value is RPT_ETK_TOOL_BASED all other bypasses are switched off.
To switch between the different bypass methods the calibration constant C_RPT_MODE has to be set accor-
dantly. After power on the calibration values are copied to RPT_MODE. The following modes are possible:
RPT_OFF and RPT_ETK.
? States of Bypass system
States of the bypass system is represented by the variable RPT_MNG_STATE.
The following states are possible:
State Physical value Description
RPT_MNG_OFF 0 RPT manager is not active
RPT_MNG_NO_INIT 1 RPT manager is not initialized-RPT will not work.
RPT_MNG_READY 2 RPT manager is initialized and is ready for work.
RPT_MNG_RUNNING 3 RPT manager is active and working.
RPT_MNG_NO_EVAL 4 RPT manager was active before and old data are stored and
used in bypass variables.
The default state for the bypass system is RPT_MNG_OFF.
The state RPT_MNG_NO_INIT is set in a start-up function which is called before the reset. The system goes to
ready after initialization of RPT and also during igk_off_to_on. The state RPT_MNG_RUNNING will be reached
if the bypass system is active and ready for work. The system is only running if it was initialized and the
state RPT_MNG_RUNNING is reached. The state RPT_MNG_NO_EVAL will be reached if the bypass system was
already working and is switched off by LC_ETK_SBB_ENABLED=0. The system will react like in chapter ?Error
handling? described (See point 1 & 2).
? Error handling
For SBB and GSI the error handling is the same. In some cases the systems are working in a different way. The
differences are written during the explanation.GSI is currently not supported

? Measurement and Calibration
(GSI is currently not supported)
Measurement and Calibration is also supported via the DSPACE GSI interface. The measurement and cal-
ibration functionality is available independent from an active rapid prototyping session via the connected
GSI interface.
In order to be able to update the reference page in the ECU?s memory the DSPACE?s ?ashing tool integrated
in CalDesk is supported. The delivered ?ash project enables the user to update the calibration data area of
the ECU.
In order to activate the Measurement and Calibration features, an ECU equipped with a GSI interface has
to be coded accordingly. This is done by:
1. Connecting the GSI interface

## Function

This document describes the control logic for a CAN Calibration Protocol (CCP) implementation, specifically focusing on tuning parameters. The document outlines the activation, deactivation, and formula sections for handling specific CCP commands used for connection, disconnection, retrieving version information, and exchanging ID information.

## Inputs

*   CCP Command (e.g., 0x01, 0x07, 0x1B, 0x17)
*   CRO Station Address (NC_CCP_STATION_ADR)
*   CRO Disconnect Type
*   EIS_ARRAY (Exchange ID Array)
*   CCP_PRIV_SUP
*   CCP_PRIV_ACT

## Outputs

*   CCP_STATE (ONLINE/OFFLINE)
*   Positive Answer (CAN message data)
*   ODT_STATE_w_STATE (DAQ state)
*   CCP_MTAO (address of EIS_ARRAY)

## Logic Flow

The logic flow describes the execution of specific CCP commands:

1.  **General Operation:** The CCP module is activated when a CCP command is received, setting `CCP_STATE` to `ONLINE`. Deactivation sets `CCP_STATE` to `OFFLINE`.

2.  **CONNECT (CCP Command = 0x01):**
    *   If the received CCP command is 0x01:
        *   Set the CRO station address using `NC_CCP_STATION_ADR`.
        *   Return a positive answer.
        *   Otherwise (Else (2)):
            *   Set `CCP_STATE` to `OFFLINE`.
            *   The ECU is disconnected.

3.  **DISCONNECT (CCP Command = 0x07):**
    *   If the received CCP command is 0x07:
        *   Set the CRO station address using `NC_CCP_STATION_ADR`.
        *   If the CRO disconnect type is 0x01:
            *   This indicates the end of the session.
            *   Set `ODT_STATE_w_STATE` based on the DAQ operation:
                *   If DAQ data is currently being sent from the ECU:
                    *   Suspend DAQ sending and set `ODT_STATE_w_STATE` = 0x03.
                *   Otherwise:
                    *   Stop DAQ sending and set `ODT_STATE_w_STATE` = 0x00.
        *   Otherwise (Else (3)):
            *   This is a temporary disconnect.
        *   Set `CCP_STATE` to `OFFLINE`.
        *   Return a positive answer.

4.  **GET_CCP_VERSION (CCP Command = 0x1B):**
    *   If the received CCP command is 0x1B:
        *   Return a positive answer, with data encoded in the transmitted frame.
        *   Byte 3 = 0x02
        *   Byte 4 = 0x01

5.  **EXCHANGE_ID (CCP Command = 0x17):**
    *   If the received CCP command is 0x17:
        *   Update the content of the `EIS_ARRAY`.
        *   Set the `CCP_MTAO` to the address of `EIS_ARRAY`.
        *   Return a positive answer, with the data encoded in the transmitted frame:
        *   Byte 3 = Size of `EIS_ARRAY`
        *   Byte 4 = 0xD7
        *   Byte 5 = `CCP_PRIV_SUP`
        *   Byte 6 = `CCP_PRIV_ACT` XOR `CCP_PRIV_SUP`



--- Page 18 ---

## Function
This document describes the MCPC (CAN calibration protocol tuning) and its associated CCP (CAN Calibration Protocol) commands for setting status, getting status, and testing. It also outlines the data acquisition setting commands and their initialization.

It also outlines the data acquisition setting commands and their initialization.

## Inputs
*   CCP Command: 0x0C (SET\_S\_STATUS), 0x0D (GET\_S\_STATUS), 0x05 (TEST)
*   CRO Byte 2
*   CCP\_PRIV\_ACT
*   NC\_CCP\_STATION\_ADR (CRO station address)

## Outputs
*   CCP\_S\_STATE (Status)
*   LV\_CPP\_STORE\_CAL (Calibration Store)
*   LV\_CCP\_STORE\_CFG (Configuration Store)
*   CCP\_SUSP\_CFG (Suspension Configuration)
*   CCP\_SUSP\_CTR (Suspension Counter)
*   CRO station address
*   Positive Answer
*   Data on transmitted frame (Byte 3 = CCP_S_STATE, Byte 4 = 0x00)

## Logic Flow

The document describes three CCP commands and the logic flow for each.

**1. SET\_S\_STATUS (CCP Command = 0x0C):**

*   CRO Byte 2 is bitwise ANDed with 0xC7.
*   CCP\_S\_STATE is set to CRO Byte 2.
*   If (CRO Byte 2 & 0x40) AND (CCP\_PRIV\_ACT & 0x01) are true:
    *   Store calibration at power latch.
    *   LV\_CPP\_STORE\_CAL = 1
*   Else:
    *   No calibration store.
    *   LV\_CPP\_STORE\_CAL = 0
*   If (CRO Byte 2 & 0x04) AND (CCP\_PRIV\_ACT & 0x02) are true:
    *   Store configurations at power latch.
    *   LV\_CCP\_STORE\_CFG = 1
    *   CCP\_SUSP\_CFG = 1
    *   CCP\_SUSP\_CTR = 0
*   Else:
    *   No configuration store.
    *   LV\_CCP\_STORE\_CFG = 0
    *   CCP\_SUSP\_CFG = 0
    *   CCP\_SUSP\_CTR = 0
*   Return a positive answer.

**2. GET\_S\_STATUS (CCP Command = 0x0D):**

*   Return a positive answer.
*   Byte 3 of the transmitted frame is set to CCP\_S\_STATE.
*   Byte 4 of the transmitted frame is set to 0x00.

**3. TEST (CCP Command = 0x05):**
